thread.title: Actress Meryl Streep to head Berlin film festival jury for 2016 edition in February
thread.title_full: Actress Meryl Streep to head Berlin film festival jury for 2016 edition in February

title: Actress Meryl Streep to head Berlin film festival jury for 2016 edition in February
text:
The Canadian Press - ONLINE EDITION Actress Meryl Streep to head Berlin film festival jury for 2016 edition in February By: The Associated Press Enlarge Image 
FILE - In this Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015 file photo, Meryl Streep poses for photographers upon her arrival at the premiere of the film Suffragette, and is also the opening gala of the London film festival. Meryl Streep has been chosen to head the jury at the Berlin International Film Festival in February. Organizers said Wednesday Oct. 14, 2015, it will be the first time in her career that the Oscar-winning 66-year-old actress has served on a film festival jury. (Photo by Joel Ryan/Invision/AP, File) 
BERLIN - Meryl Streep has been chosen to head the jury at the Berlin International Film Festival in February. 
Organizers said Wednesday it will be the first time in her career that the Oscar-winning 66-year-old actress has served on a film festival jury. 
Streep said in a statement released by the festival: "The responsibility is somewhat daunting, as I have never been president of anything before." She added that she is "grateful for the honour." 
The Berlin festival honoured Streep for her lifetime achievement in 2012. 
The 2016 event, the first of the year's major European film festivals, runs Feb. 11-21. The seven-member jury at this year's event was led by American director Darren Aronofsky. 
There was no immediate word on who will serve alongside Streep on the 2016 jury.
